headline: Nvidia stock: Making sense of the Peter Thiel, Michael Burry moves
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) shares are in focus this week, but not just because of its third quarter earnings, which are scheduled to be released after the close on Wednesday. The stock is also making headlines due to Peter Thiel's fund selling the tech giant's shares and Michael Burry betting against them. Washington Crossing Advisors senior portfolio manager Chad Morganlander explains why two Wall Street giants may be making these bets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Peter Thiel Cuts Stake In PayPal Mafia Company Tesla. Musk Issues This Warning.
summary: Peter Thiel's hedge fund Thiel Macro sold around 76% of its stake in Tesla during the third quarter, according to the 13F filing, as the billionaire decided to reduce his holdings in fellow PayPal Mafia-member Elon Musk's EV giant amid possible AI bubble risks.  Thiel Macro sold 207,613 TSLA shares in Q3, cutting its Tesla position by about 76%.  After those sales, Thiel's fund holds 65,000 shares of Tesla, which remain its largest investment, valued at $28.91 million and representing 38.83% of the portfolio.

raw.headline: Peter Thiel Cuts Stake In PayPal Mafia Company Tesla. Musk Issues This Warning.
raw.summary: Peter Thiel's hedge fund Thiel Macro sold around 76% of its stake in Tesla during the third quarter, according to the 13F filing, as the billionaire decided to reduce his holdings in fellow PayPal Mafia-member Elon Musk's EV giant amid possible AI bubble risks.  Thiel Macro sold 207,613 TSLA shares in Q3, cutting its Tesla position by about 76%.  After those sales, Thiel's fund holds 65,000 shares of Tesla, which remain its largest investment, valued at $28.91 million and representing 38.83% of the portfolio.

headline: GMI Cloud to build $500 million AI data centre in Taiwan with Nvidia chips
summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -U.S.-based cloud services provider GMI Cloud said on Monday it will build a $500 million artificial intelligence data centre ​in Taiwan with the support of U.S. chipmaker Nvidia.  The data centre will come ‌online by March 2026 and will run on Nvidia’s new Blackwell GB300 chips.  GMI Cloud Founder and CEO Alex Yeh said Taiwan needs more data centres as “strategic assets” to support its AI development, adding that the island’s power-supply challenges can be remedied.⁠ He said AI demand has been ‌strong, with the company's GPU utilisation “almost full”.

raw.headline: GMI Cloud to build $500 million AI data centre in Taiwan with Nvidia chips
raw.summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -U.S.-based cloud services provider GMI Cloud said on Monday it will build a $500 million artificial intelligence data centre ​in Taiwan with the support of U.S. chipmaker Nvidia.  The data centre will come ‌online by March 2026 and will run on Nvidia’s new Blackwell GB300 chips.  GMI Cloud Founder and CEO Alex Yeh said Taiwan needs more data centres as “strategic assets” to support its AI development, adding that the island’s power-supply challenges can be remedied.⁠ He said AI demand has been ‌strong, with the company's GPU utilisation “almost full”.

headline: GMI Cloud to Launch Next-Gen AI Factory in Taiwan with NVIDIA to Power the Future of AI Infrastructure in Asia
summary: GMI Cloud, a NVIDIA Cloud Partner and one of the fastest-growing GPU-as-a-Service providers, today announced the launch of a new AI Factory in Taiwan. The $500 million dollar AI Factory will serve as a key pillar of the region's AI infrastructure, enabling enterprises to train and deploy AI models at unprecedented scale.
